intro: Hoya phyllura, commonly known as the "Coral Hoya," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its waxy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, coral-pink flowers. The plant produces its flowers in the axils of its leaves, often blooming in shades of pink to red. Hoya phyllura is a climbing plant that can be trained to grow on trellises or supports. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
